subtopics:
üìå ‡§á‡§∏ ‡§µ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§™ ‡§∏‡•Ä‡§ñ‡•á‡§Ç‡§ó‡•á:

üëâ Angular application start ‡§π‡•ã‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ flow  

üëâ index.html ‡§ï‡§æ role  

üëâ <app-root> ‡§ï‡•à‡§∏‡•á work ‡§ï‡§∞‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à  

üëâ main.ts entry point  

üëâ Bootstrap process explained  

üëâ Root component ‡§ï‡•à‡§∏‡•á load ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à  

üëâ Interview-focused explanation

interviewQuestions.question: What is Angular application flow?
interviewQuestions.answer: It describes how an Angular application starts and how control moves from index.html to components.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the entry point of an Angular application?
interviewQuestions.answer: main.ts

interviewQuestions.question: What is the role of index.html in Angular?
interviewQuestions.answer: It is the host HTML file where the Angular application is loaded.

interviewQuestions.question: What is <app-root> in Angular?
interviewQuestions.answer: It is the selector of the root component where the application is rendered.

interviewQuestions.question: Which file bootstraps the Angular application?
interviewQuestions.answer: main.ts

interviewQuestions.question: What happens when an Angular application starts?
interviewQuestions.answer:
index.html loads, Angular finds , main.ts bootstraps

the root component, and the component tree is rendered.

interviewQuestions.question: What is bootstrapping in Angular?
interviewQuestions.answer: It is the process of initializing and launching the Angular application.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the role of bootstrapApplication() or bootstrapModule()?
interviewQuestions.answer: They initialize the Angular app and load the root component.

interviewQuestions.question: How does Angular render a component on the screen?
interviewQuestions.answer: By linking the component class with its template and inserting it into the DOM.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the difference between module-based and standalone bootstrapping?
interviewQuestions.answer: Module-based uses AppModule, while standalone bootstraps directly from a component.

interviewQuestions.question: What role does change detection play in application flow?
interviewQuestions.answer: It keeps the view updated with the latest component data.

interviewQuestions.question: What are common issues in Angular application flow?
interviewQuestions.answer: Incorrect bootstrap setup, missing root component, routing misconfiguration, or service scope issues.

interviewQuestions.question: Why is Angular application flow important?
interviewQuestions.answer: It helps understand how Angular works internally.

interviewQuestions.question: What is selector in angular ?
interviewQuestions.answer:
Selector is use to target component in angular.

ex:- in component app-root is selector

interviewQuestions.question: üìçExplanation of Complete Angular Application Flow end to end .
interviewQuestions.answer:
1Ô∏è‚É£ npm start

Runs the script defined in package.json

"start": "ng serve"


2Ô∏è‚É£ Angular CLI reads angular.json

  • angular.json contains project configuration
  • Angular CLI checks:
  • Project name
  • Build & serve options
  • Assets, styles, scripts
  • Default port (4200) and other dev-server settings

üìå Example: we can set port if required other than 4200.


"serve": {

 "options": {

  "port": 4200

 }

}


3Ô∏è‚É£ Dev server starts

  • Angular CLI starts the development server on the configured port
  • Browser opens:

http://localhost:4200

4Ô∏è‚É£ index.html loads

  • First file rendered in the browser

Contains:

<app-root></app-root>

<script src="main.js">

5Ô∏è‚É£ main.ts executes

  • Entry point of Angular
  • Bootstraps the app:

bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, appConfig);


6Ô∏è‚É£ app.config.ts loads

  • Registers:
  • Providers
  • Routing
  • Interceptors
  • Global configuration

7Ô∏è‚É£ AppComponent loads

  • Root component with selector app-root

8Ô∏è‚É£ Selector matches in index.html

  • Angular replaces <app-root> with:
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • TS logic

9Ô∏è‚É£ Lifecycle hooks run

  • constructor
  • ngOnInit

üîü UI is rendered


Diagram Representation


npm start

 |

 | (package.json)

 |

ng serve

 |

 | (Angular CLI)

 |

angular.json

 | ‚Üí Port (4200)

 | ‚Üí Build & Serve config

 |

Dev Server Running

 |

Browser loads

 |

index.html

 | ‚Üí <app-root>

 |

main.ts

 | ‚Üí bootstrapApplication()

 |

app.config.ts

 | ‚Üí providers

 | ‚Üí routing

 |

AppComponent

 | ‚Üí selector: app-root

 |

Component Lifecycle

 | ‚Üí constructor

 | ‚Üí ngOnInit

 |

UI Rendered

interviewQuestions.question: What is the command to install Angular CLI globally?
interviewQuestions.answer: npm install -g @angular/cli

interviewQuestions.question: What is npm and why is it needed for Angular?
interviewQuestions.answer: npm (Node Package Manager) is used to install and manage JavaScript packages/dependencies required for Angular projects

interviewQuestions.question: What are the prerequisites for Angular development?
interviewQuestions.answer: Node.js, npm, and a code editor (like VS Code)

interviewQuestions.question: How do you create a new Angular project?
interviewQuestions.answer: ng new projectname

interviewQuestions.question: What command is used to start an Angular development server?
interviewQuestions.answer: npm start or ng serve

interviewQuestions.question: On which port does Angular run by default?
interviewQuestions.answer: Port 4200 (http://localhost:4200)

interviewQuestions.question: How do you check if Angular CLI is installed?
interviewQuestions.answer: ng version or ng --version

interviewQuestions.question: What is the difference between npm start and ng serve?
interviewQuestions.answer: npm start runs the script defined in package.json (usually ng serve), while ng serve directly uses Angular CLI

interviewQuestions.question: How do you run Angular on a different port?
interviewQuestions.answer: ng serve --port 4500 or modify angular.json

interviewQuestions.question: What files are created when you run ng new projectname?
interviewQuestions.answer: package.json, angular.json, tsconfig files, src folder, node_modules, etc.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the difference between --skip-install and --skip-git flags?
interviewQuestions.answer: --skip-install skips npm install, --skip-git skips git repository initialization

interviewQuestions.question: How do you install Angular CLI locally (not globally)?
interviewQuestions.answer: npm install @angular/cli --save-dev

interviewQuestions.question: How do you open Angular app automatically in browser after running ng serve?
interviewQuestions.answer: ng serve --open or ng serve -o

subtopics: Role of each important file & folder
How folder structure helps in scalable projects

interviewQuestions.question: What is the main folder of an Angular project?
interviewQuestions.answer: The src folder. It contains the complete source code of the application.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the purpose of the app folder?
interviewQuestions.answer: It contains components, services, routing, and modules or standalone components.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the use of the assets folder?
interviewQuestions.answer: To store static files like images, icons, fonts, and JSON files.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the role of index.html in Angular?
interviewQuestions.answer: It is the single host HTML file where the Angular application is loaded.

interviewQuestions.question: Why is main.ts important?
interviewQuestions.answer: It is the entry point of the Angular application where the app is bootstrapped.

interviewQuestions.question: What is role of angular.json?
interviewQuestions.answer:
angular.json defines project structure and build configurations used by Angular CLI commands like ng serve, ng build, and ng test.
or
it is the central configuration file that controls Angular CLI behavior for building, serving, testing, and managing assets and environments in an Angular project.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the purpose of package.json?
interviewQuestions.answer: It manages project dependencies, scripts, and metadata.

interviewQuestions.question: Why do we use the environments folder?
interviewQuestions.answer: To manage different environment configurations like development and production.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the difference between styles.css and component styles?
interviewQuestions.answer:
styles.css ‚Üí Global styles

Component styles ‚Üí Scoped to that component only

interviewQuestions.question: Why is node_modules not pushed to GitHub?
interviewQuestions.answer: Because dependencies can be recreated using package.json and it increases repo size.

interviewQuestions.question: Why is a feature-based folder structure recommended?
interviewQuestions.answer: It improves scalability, maintainability, and code readability.

interviewQuestions.question: What is the difference between Core and Shared folders?
interviewQuestions.answer:
Core ‚Üí Singleton services like Auth, Guards, Interceptors

Shared ‚Üí Reusable components, directives, and pipes

interviewQuestions.question: How do standalone components improve folder structure?
interviewQuestions.answer: They remove the dependency on modules, making the structure simpler and cleaner.

interviewQuestions.question: What are common folder structure mistakes in Angular projects?
interviewQuestions.answer:
Putting everything inside the app folder
No feature separation
Duplicating shared logic

interviewQuestions.question: What is the use of Package.lock.json ?
interviewQuestions.answer:
when we are running npm install, package-lock.json ensures that a particular (exact) library version is installed on your local machine.

üëâ package.json says what you want
üëâ package-lock.json says what exactly got installed

package-lock.json ensures that the exact same versions of libraries and their dependencies are installed on every machine.
This helps avoid version mismatch issues and keeps the application consistent across development, testing, and production.

‚ö†Ô∏è Common Mistake
‚ùå Deleting package-lock.json
‚úî Always commit it to Git
